title: Moet & Chandon Champagne font
content:
Hi everydbody ! Could anyone give me help on identifying this typeface ? I'm not sure wether it's a custom lettering or a specific face. The rounded shapes may also be due to tampography (is that correct ? printing on a 3D object anyway) Seems like it's an 19th century woodtype style. Several font search engines didn't work... Thanks a lot for help !   
 ![Moet & Chandon Champagnes](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101002726im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/21331.jpg)
author: szlobodan

comments.content: There's a very striking disparity between the 'O's and 'N's, but I don't know if that's just the sample you posted.
I noticed it, but since the lined full caps logo are approximately the same weight, it might be part of a whole set. Maybe that stylistic disparity is part of the font !
What screen resolution are you running, Yves? I'm on 1024x768 and the page width is fine ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101002726im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
Okay, thank you guys for help ! I'll check my pix sizes next time !

Hi szlobodan, I was looking for the typeface myself as well and discovered it looks a lot like the ”Marbrook”. Needs a little customizing, but it will work.

A very usefull site is: [http://www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101002726/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/ "http://www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/")

You can upload a picture and the site automatically searches the typeface you're looking for!

Indeed -- you can find all this information in my handy [Frequently Asked Questions](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101002726/http:/typophile.com/forums/typeid/faq) post which nobody seems to read. ;^)

Apart from the top serif on the "A", you can get pretty   
close with [ITC Weidemann](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101002726/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-weidemann/medium/testdrive.html?s=MO%CBT%20%26%20CHANDON&p=60).   
   
P.S. That's one big-a$$ sample you posted there.   
Next time maybe scale it to more wieldy dimensions.   
It's messing with the page width. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101002726im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)
